etymology.description: Semantic: 殳(殳) (shū, "weapon/tool") + Phonetic: 𠂤(𠂤) (yì, no standalone meaning) = originally related to bravery involving weapons -> firm, resolute
etymology.interpretation: 毅(毅) (yì, "firm; resolute; courageous") combines the concept of weapons or tools, associated with strength and warfare from 殳(殳) (shū, "weapon/tool"), with 𠂤(𠂤) to provide the phonetic element, emphasizing traits of bravery and courage necessary in warfare. Over time, it came to signify resoluteness and firmness in character.

examples.chinese: 面对挫折(面對挫折)，他依然保持了毅(毅)。
examples.pinyin: Miànduì cuòzhé, tā yīrán bǎochíle yì.
examples.english: In the face of setbacks, he still maintained his resoluteness.

examples.chinese: 他的毅让人肃然起敬(他的毅讓人肅然起敬)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de yì ràng rén sùrán qǐjìng.
